data.question: What is the chemical formula of the compound synthesized by diffusion of triethylamine into an ethanol solution containing 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid and zinc(II) nitrate hexahydrate?

Is the Zn−BTC framework selective towards the binding of alcohols?
What is the role of triethylamine in the synthesis of Zn2(BTC)(NO3)·(H2O)(C2H5OH)5?
data.answer: It acts as a noncoordinating base for the deprotonation of 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid.

data.question: Can the guest molecules in Zn2(BTC)(NO3)·(H2O)(C2H5OH)5 be removed or exchanged without destroying the porous framework?

What is the calculated pore volume of the Zn−BTC framework after complete removal of five ethanol and one water molecule per formula unit?
Is the Zn−BTC framework capable of selectively binding nonalcoholic molecules?
What is the role of the multidentate functionality of BTC in the Zn−BTC framework?
data.answer: It imparts rigidity and stability to the resulting porous framework.

data.question: Can the Zn−BTC framework undergo reversible binding of guests?
What is the significance of the Zn−BTC framework's selectivity towards alcohols?
data.answer: It illustrates the relevance of coordination chemistry in providing opportunities for accessing metal centers within such networks.

data.question: Is the Zn−BTC framework derived from the chiral Si net in SrSi2?

data.answer: Compression of the cubic cell by 0.462 Å

data.question: Is the Zn−BTC framework capable of undergoing dynamic exchange cycles involving the absorption−desorption and reabsorption-desorption of alcohols?
What is the role of the Zn−BTC framework in the development of zeolitic properties of materials?
data.answer: It advances the principles of using the molecular building block approach for the construction of functional porous extended solids.
